text: ------------------------------ Anybody have any code quality tools / setups that they use within their HubL coded templates to validate output / send alerts to a monitoring team? (we have a client that really wants to know when images fail to load or links are broken)

I was thinking that maybe what I wanted was a feature in HubSpot to more gracefully handle errors in HubL (but then I remembered it's all server-side and if it compiles and publishes then it's done its job) -- the rest is front-end and would require user-side monitoring
I used new relic before.. they have so much you can check on with it
We're doing a bit of digging on our end and apparently HubSpot is using Rackspace's hybrid cloud
I'm wondering if there's any way (or plan) to open up a specific / more robust access to the hosting aspect of your individual HubSpot portal
Because rackspace has some pretty nifty alert generation tools
I would bet that is not going to happen.
If they want to keep the level of security they have they will problbay keep us out of that aspect

:disappointed: yeah figured as much - but one can dreamâ€¦ I've just got our dev team (outside of myself as the HubSpot specialist) complaining about the lack of ability to touch the server / backend beyond HubL, HubDb, and API access
It is difficult coming from a non HubSpot world. you have to make plenty of changes in your workflow.
hm - must have been an outdated article
how do I find the public view URL for a contact in the sales section of HubSpot?
